intro: Conyza steudelii, commonly known as the common blueweed, is an annual herbaceous plant native to Africa and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and opposite leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–100 cm, with hairy stems and serrated leaves. Its flowers are small and blue to purple in color, arranged in clusters, and it produces numerous seeds that are dispersed by the wind. Conyza steudelii is often found in disturbed soils and is considered a weed in agricultural settings.
